intro: Ferulago mughlae, commonly known as the Mughla ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive scent when crushed, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Ferulago mughlae is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
